Sec. 1-1. Words and phrases. (a) In the construction of the statutes, words and phrases shall be construed according to the commonly approved usage of the language.

(b) The phrase "railroad company" shall be construed to mean and include all corporations, trustees, receivers or other persons.

(1949 Rev., S. 3639; P.A. 21-1, S. 143.)

History: Multiple amendments over the years.

Sec. 1-2. Legal notices. Legal notices required by law shall be published in a newspaper having general circulation.

(1949 Rev., S. 3640.)
